recount3 0.99.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • recount3 quick start guide
  • Changelog

Read a metadata file

Source: R/read_metadata.R
read_metadata.Rd

This function reads in a recount3 metadata file into R. You can first locate the file using file_locate_url() then download it to your computer using file_retrieve().

read_metadata(metadata_file)

Arguments

metadata_file

A character(1) with the local path to a recount3 metadata file.

Value

A data.frame() with all lower case column names for the sample metadata.

Examples


## Download the metadata file for project ERP001942
url_ERP001942_meta <- file_locate_url("ERP001942", "data_sources/sra")
local_ERP001942_meta <- file_retrieve(url = url_ERP001942_meta)

## Read the metadata
ERP001942_meta <- read_metadata(local_ERP001942_meta)
head(ERP001942_meta)

#> 1 Total RNA was extracted from cell pellets using the                     TRIzol Reagent (Ambion). The pellets had been frozen at ECACC without any                     additives like RNAlater or Trizol. In Geneva they were thawed, 1mL of trizol                     was added in each sample, and the samples were transferred to eppendorf tubes.                     The rest of the protocol followed the manufacturer's guidelines. No DNase                     treatment was done to the RNA samples. Sample processing for sequencing was                     done in a random order in each of the seven laboratories. Library preparation                     was done with TruSeq RNA Sample Prep Kit v2 using the high-throughput                     protocol.

#> 1 Alias;;GEUV:NA20508|Broker name;;ArrayExpress|Description;;Protocols: For more information about the populations, ELSI, etc., see http://www.1000genomes.org/about#ProjectSamples and http://ccr.coriell.org/Default.aspx. EVB transformed lymphoblastoid cell lines (LCLs) from Coriell Cell Repositories (GBR, FIN, TSI) and University of Geneva (CEU, YRI) were shipped to ECACC (European COllection of Cell Cultures) as live cultures (06/2011 - 09/2011), in batches of ~ 30 samples from Coriell (GBR/FIN/TSI more or less randomized) and 2 x ~90 samples (by population) from Geneva. In ECACC, these cell lines were cultures to approximately 1.2 x 10e8 cells (06/2011-10/2011). These cultures were split to produce 8 x cell banks of the samples, and a snap frozen pellet of 2 x 10e7 cells from a proliferating culture. The cell pellets were shipped from ECACC to University of Geneva in three batches, the first batch consisting of CEU/GBR/FIN/TSI samples, and the second and third batch with YRI and some CEU samples. Total RNA was extracted from cell pellets using the TRIzol Reagent (Ambion). The pellets had been frozen at ECACC without any additives like RNAlater or Trizol. In Geneva they were thawed, 1mL of trizol was added in each sample, and the samples were transferred to eppendorf tubes. The rest of the protocol followed the manufacturer's guidelines. No DNAse treatment was done to the RNA samples. The RNA quality was assessed by Agilent Bioanalyzer RNA 6000 Nano Kit according to the manufacturer's instructions. The sample information includes a visual inspection of RNA quality (degradation), in the scale 0, 0.5, 1. RNA quantity was measured by Qubit 2.0 (Invitrogen) using the RNA Broad range kit according to the manufacturer's instructions.|INSDC center alias;;Geuvadis|INSDC center name;;Geuvadis|INSDC first public;;2012-11-06T17:02:05Z|INSDC last update;;2018-03-08T16:06:35Z|INSDC status;;public|population;;TSI|Sample Name;;ERS185362|SRA accession;;ERS185362|Strain;;lymphoblastoid cell line|Title;;NA20508

## Locate and read the GTEx bladder metadata
gtex_bladder_meta <- read_metadata(
    file_retrieve(
        file_locate_url("BLADDER", "data_sources/gtex")
    )
)
#> adding rname 'http://snaptron.cs.jhu.edu/data/temp/recount3/human/data_sources/gtex/metadata/ER/BLADDER/gtex.metadata.BLADDER.MD.gz'
